data: Establishes a lexical resource based on WordNet, assigning sentiment scores (objectivity, positivity, negativity) to individual word meanings (synsets).

Contains approximately 5,000 text snippets, collected from financial news and press releases about Finnish companies traded on the NASDAQ OMX Nordic Exchange. Each snippet is classified as positive, negative, or neutral.

A dataset dedicated to understanding sentiment in financial texts, combining artificial intelligence and semantic web technologies to improve the recognition, interpretation, and processing of opinions within this context.

Includes entity-linked sentiment annotation to address the challenge of headlines containing multiple entities with potentially conflicting sentiments. This human-annotated dataset, comprising over 10,700 news headlines, provides insights into sentiment variations based on specific entities in financial news.

A tokenized and annotated dataset of Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) speeches, meeting minutes, and press conference transcripts. This resource aims to understand the impact of monetary policy on financial markets by analyzing the language used by the central bank.

An annotated dataset for relations within financial documents, containing approximately 29,000 instances and 22 relation types across eight entity pairs (e.g., Person-Position, Organization-Money), extracted from SEC 10-X filings. Useful for identifying relationships between entities in financial reports.
A dataset collected from various news sources and evaluated by human experts, allowing researchers to explore how news headlines affect price movements, asset comparisons, and other financial events.
A dataset designed for Named Entity Recognition (NER) within the financial landscape, aiding in the identification and classification of financial companies within textual data.

Provides a multilingual financial Natural Language Processing (NLP) dataset featuring factual financial article headlines in 15 languages. Annotated with high- and low-level topics, facilitating multi-class and multi-label classification tasks.

A collection of question-answer pairs with in-depth analysis of financial reports. Written by financial experts, it focuses on deep reasoning over financial data, providing training data for answering complex financial inquiries.
